comment: if i had to take this class again, idk if i would. in hindsight, it doesn't seem too bad- BUT for-sure ,my least favorite class! we learn alot of absolutely nothing & get quizzed on stuff that never seems to align with any of the other work we have. i took her in person and never returned after the second week. if you do take, try it online???
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: She seems like a lovely person but her teaching style is not engaging. I took the class in person and it could've been taken online for the exact same affect because all she did was read slides. If you are considering taking one of her classes in person, take it online. Her grading system of weekly quizzes was more difficult then I was expecting.
The class is entirely lectures she reads right off the PowerPoint. 2 weekly quizzes and 5 tests (drops 1)

Dr. Eugene is alright. She seems like a great person, but her lectures can be long and boring. She goes over her labs every week and shows the process which helps with those, but most of the time the class notes don't help with the quizzes/tests which are proctored with Responds. The class itself is easy so it wasn't hard.

This was a 4 hr online class that was honestly not that bad. The material was pretty easy, but the professor didn't teach. It was just weekly labs and 5 exam grades. She dropped a lot of grades and is merciful. Take her if you want to pass a class.

Unclear rubrics and assignments will enforce some due dates and change others. She doesn't respond to emails at all during finals. Our grades from beginning of November still aren't in and she wont return tests back and grades are due in less than a week. Legit the one of the worst professors I've ever had.
The class labs are really easy.  Also, the tests are easy.  If you want an easy A, I recommend registering in this class. I had a terrific time taking this online class.

I felt pretty disconnected from my professor during my time taking this course- I didn't need much help nor did she talk to the class much. There's a good bit of work in this class (labs, homework, and powerpoints). However, wasn't too difficult given some labs or work could be done by just looking over the documents and completing the quiz

This is another class where you have to pay to do homework, lame. It's actually a pretty easy class, but the amount of work you gotta do with labs is obscene. Lockdown browser for EVERYTHING, even the pre-course quiz! I had a technical issue with Lockdown, and she was no help. For such an easy class, don't make this harder than it needs to. Avoid.

Dr. Jones is a fine professor if you're trying to satisfy a general science requirement. Her lectures are not really helpful to go to as all of her study materials are provided to you on D2L. I wouldn't say this class is an easy A, but it's very doable.

This class was pretty easy. Most concepts were built from high school curriculum. Weekly labs and quizzes which are pretty straight forward. If you review the powerpoints and study the kahoot, you'll do well on the exams. Attendance is not required as all the assignments are online. Overall, her class is easy, especially for non-science majors.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: Prof. Jones is very boring to listen to when she lectures the PowerPoint every class, but she does know what she's talking about. She assigns too much work per week including a lab, lab quiz, regular quiz/exam and you have 3 weeks to do the homework. Attendance does not count so I wouldn't worry about going because you can do everything online.
She doesn't have the best personality and just reads from her PowerPoints in class. All study materials are provided, you just have to put in the time to pass.

Her lectures are not a necessity to pass, she just reads through the powerpoints that are available on d2l. However, she is very accommodating; your lowest test/quiz/lab grades are dropped, and the course material is usually simple (some labs were kind of tricky). The toughest part of taking this course was paying for the textbook.

Please do not take her. She gives two quizzes every week and all of her tests are lockdown and webcam. Her lectures are terribly dry and boring. She reads off the ppt and would answer incorrectly to students. Her tests weren't hard (just read over the ppt and you will pass). Homework is on Pearson and you're required to do one discussion post.

Professor Jones had multiple weekly assignments that were very easy IMO. It's pointless showing up to her lectures cause all she really does is laugh and give off the vibe that she doesn't know the content, so I basically taught myself. Her "labs" can be somewhat complicated.

Doesn't really seem to know what she's going over. lectures are so many slides, but you're better off reading them yourself instead of listening to her. Went to class on the first day and didn't go back after. Found a study group and took the whole class online. Quizzes and tests are easy, but she makes the material confusing. Find a study group.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: I went to her for the first couple weeks and gave up. I stopped going to class and actually learned something. If you have to take this class do NOT take her. Her lectures are ridiculous and have no purpose. She reads powerpoints made by people who made the textbook. You can literally skip every lecture do the class completely online and get an A.

I learned almost nothing in this class. The lectures left me more confused about the assignments. I stopped going to lectures. You'll probably take a lab quiz and module quiz every week, then the unit exam and a unit homework due at the end of the units. Quizzes are pretty difficult and are all on lockdown (she changed lab quizzes to open note.)

I needed a science class, I thought this one sounded straightforward enough. I was wrong. Really wrong. Like, tragically and horribly wrong. She only unlocks lesson quizzes and lab tests half-way through the week. So you've got twice as much coursework that's due on Sunday. Will use Lockdown Browser for everything even for 5 questions.

Don't do it

Worst Professor Ive ever encountered on the Kennesaw State University campus. Seems to me that after receiving her "Doctorate" she took a very long vacation and has yet to come back. Cant answer simple syllabus related questions. STAY AWAY.

Tiffani Jones is a true inspiration to those who have no direction or future, because if somehow she can teach a class, there has to be a way for you to become Elon Musk. Only positive was the amount of nap time I got during her lectures really comes in clutch as a first year student. Otherwise as far as teaching, she doesn't.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Tiffani-Eugene Jones is the type of professor that does not become available often, from concise and clear communication, to making sure every question is answered, Dr. Jones engages each listener during the 1 hour and fifteen minute lectures.

Every single lecture Professor Jones reads the PowerPoint like it is the first time she's ever seen it. Pretty much a waste of time coming to her class when everything she "teaches" is posted online. I basically taught myself this course. Stay away

This is the worse professor I have ever had. Going to her class is like watching paint dry, its so boring. All she does is read off a powerpoint like a broken tape recorder. It's more of a challenge to stay awake in her class than actually doing the work. Some people should of never went for their bachelor degree and she is one of those people.

All quizzes and exams are on lockdown browser with webcam. You take 12 lab quizzes, which mainly assess you on how the lab is structured rather than the results you get on questions. Questions are worded poorly and designed to trick you as there could be multiple answers required with no indication of that.

Very barebones and mediocre professor. Don't expect anything revolutionary to be discussed as 90% of it is reading off of the power points word for word and watching YouTube videos. Be wary of the tests, it's multiple choice but they feel like they're intentionally designed to trip you up and lose points.

What were they thinking? Lots of homework. So glad I dropped this last semester. I was entering as a sophomore and needed to start taking science and so I took her course. Biggest mistake if my life. And I ate some nasty stuff as a kid. Sad sad that kennesaw hired her. Praying for the kids to actually get an education in class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Horrible class. Totally unprepared to teach. Shame of the 21st century and our education system as a whole. Totally obvious she doesnt care about her job. Id do anything to not take this class. Plenty of other science professors who actually care to a minimum but she doesnt even do that. Find someone else
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: she literally doesnt care about her students whatsoever and she definitely should not be teaching. she doesnt know how to teach a lecture and just reads off the ppt the entire time and when you ask her questions she either gets mad at you or switches the topic completely cause she doesnt know the answer. never gets back in contact w students.

I did not enjoy this class. Professor Jones was very hard to reach outside of class and does not seem to care about her students. Her grade system is a point system not a grade so you spend all semester wondering how you did. Take someone else if you can. The class material is nothing new. Most of the class does not attend after a few weeks.

She offers extra credit, her labs are a bit tricky, it's also a lot of reading. She does help if you go up to her after class, she explains it well. She does kahoots for exams and their also helpful, they have most of the same questions. She's a good teacher but I did struggle a bit with the labs. Her pp lectures line up well with the quizzes.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Offers no help. If you're a bad test taker, you will be out go luck in her class. She isn't in the slightest bit helpful, your entire grade is LAB QUIZ, MODULE QUIZ AND EXAMS. She is hard to reach, & uses lockdown browser for all quizzes. She shows no consideration for people who know the material but just are bad at tests. I am very stressed.

Labs are a little tricky, put they are pretty straight forward. She is a little learn more on your own but she answers questions and explains well if you just ask. Quizzes are based on powerpoint lectures and she also helps with labs. She is nice and if your struggling in her class, you just simply don't want to work.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: In the duration of the class I never spoke to her once. This class is a lot of reading and learning on your own. Her layout is organized with 5 test and 10 quizzes and 10 lab quizzes. She will drop lowest quiz grades if need be. This class in general is easy but with a lot of work.

This class is SO easy to get an A in. I got a 99. How? I actually read & did the weekly assignments & lab. And then, like magic, I retained it for the quizzes and tests. She even created extra recorded powerpoint presentations for the people who complained about the material. If you do poorly in this class, it is 100% on you. Just do the work.

Dr. Jones is kind, but her powerpoint lectures don't adequately prepare you for the test and multiple quizzes per unit. Most of the time, I could go off my prior knowledge to complete assignments, but it can get tricky sometimes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Jones is a nice lady but in my opinion just bad at explaining material and hard to understand in general. She made average material more confusing than it needs to be. Although she aint political she is big into the global warming thing which can be annoying. The hw in the class is easy but the exams are kinda difficult for no reason.

I took this class in Fall2020 as a dual enrolment student. She gave out way to much work every week. Each week there was module work and a lab. Which never had anything to do with each other. Each week there was 2 quizzes and on exam week 2 exams. Yes I did get an A but it was a struggle. I think there was lectures but idk she never got back to me

Dr. Jones is by far the best teacher I have had at Kennesaw. I took Sci1101 last year and got a D. However, I signed up for her last spring for Sci1102 and she helped so much. I retook Sci1101 this semester with her and my grade went from a D to a B. She is really great with extra credit and drops your lowest test grades.
There are A TON of weekly quizzes. 2-3 EVERY WEEK on an online course. Labs every week. Redundant course material. Don't bother emailing her, she won't respond with the information you needed.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Worse Professor at KSU!!!

IDK where to start. Lockdown and Webcam on everything. You could study for hours and use the lab on the lab quizzes, and still fail the quizzes. Constantly emailing to ask questions or ask to be able to see what I got wrong on the quizzes, answers with absolutely no relevant feedback and also be prepared to wait 5 days for a response. AVOID AVOID!!

attendance isn't mandatory so you don't have to show up to the lectures and you will still understand it for the tests because she posts the slides online. Lectures are just her reading off the slides so its kind of a waste of time. Tests are pretty easy and if you read the slides and take notes you can make an A

Professor Jones seemed to be caring at first, BUT it soon became clear to me that she did not give second chances... She basically gave us a paper or two every week with tons of reading. It's obvious she grades off of emotion. DO NOT expect any last minute favors. She will fail you... Most notably, she doesn't prioritize her STS class. (Side class)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: She definitely wasn't a bad professor; a very nice lady, but she was soo boring. All she did was read directly from the powerpoint for 70 minutes straight that she posted online anyway. The tests are pretty straight-forward, but you definitely need to study. If you're not really interested in learning and critical thinking she's a good fit for you.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Jones is a new teacher. However, she does provide extra credit and has curved every test grade we have. You don't have to show up to pass if you read the book, however, I would recommend going so you don't miss any information or opportunities. She also posts powerpoints online with all of the information.

Very inexperienced and does not teach effectively. Honesty didn't have the slightest idea what she was doing. Be prepared to teach yourself everything! Easy A if you spend hours pouring over the chapters in the book, as that's where she gets her tests. No need to attend class as her lectures are completely useless. Must buy the book and MES access.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Very unprepared for lectures. You don't have to go to class bc she puts powerpoints online. Terrible at answering questions. Terrible teacher. You kind of have to teach yourself but its do able. Make a quizlet with key terms and you will do fine. She did curve my grade at the end a significant amount. Not sure if she always does that though.

Probably the worst science teacher I have ever had. She is extremely unprepared for class and is extremely rude to all of her students. She basically told me that I had no chance of passing the class. She doesn't know the content she is teaching and she was completely clueless that this class is a gen ed. She said that it was for STEM majors. NOPE!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Reads right off of the powerpoints. Dont need to go to class despite what she says (just read the book or powerpoints). Need to buy MES textbook with the assignments for the hw portion of the grade. Dont expect to get an email back or clear answers. Condescending & tends to put down "non-science majors" despite this being a basic gen ed class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Jones isn't a great lecturer. Her presentations are fairly straightforward, but she simply reads off of them without much additional information. During reviews she has admitted to not knowing certain content. She posts all of her presentations online so you can learn just as much by reading them yourself as you would going to her lecture

Professor Jones class was fair. YOU HAVE TO PUT IN THE WORK FOR YOUR DESIRED GRADE. She does offer extra credit. She's also very receptive to the needs of her students! Use your resources, THE TEXTBOOK! MES is required, but very straight forward! Attendance is not mandatory but YOU'LL BENEFIT from attending!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This woman is straight awful. Professor Jones is unprepared for every single class. She reads off a pre-made PowerPoint from Pearson and tries to say its her own. She cant answer the questions properly when reviewing she literally said she didnt know the answers and skipped the questions. Do not take a class with this professor you wont do well

Not much to say about Ms. Jones. She doesnt know how to teach at all. She doesnt create the powerpoints she presents and will read them to herself then present back to you the exact same information thats already on the board. The whole reason Im doing this is bc my class put it in our groupme and so I just hope she sees this and changes.
